meanings.definition: A hard, dry biscuit or twice-baked bread.
meanings.sent1: I enjoyed dipping the rusk in my tea.
meanings.sent2: The rusk crumbled in my hand as I took a bite.
meanings.sent3: The rusk was so hard, it could break a tooth!
meanings.sent4: The rusk stood on the plate like a stone monument.
meanings.sent5: The rusk's crunch echoed in the quiet room.

meanings.definition: To toast or dry out bread in order to make it into rusks.
meanings.sent1: I will rusk the bread to make it last longer.
meanings.sent2: She rusked the loaf of bread to preserve it.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally rusked the bread too much, making it too hard to eat.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays rusked the bread left on the windowsill.
meanings.sent5: The baker carefully rusked the dough to perfection.
